intro: Sessea crassivenosa subsp. multivenosa, commonly known as the broad-veined sesse, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with multiple veins, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. This subspecies is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
